full_threads.body:
Hi William, 

Thanks for the extra detail, we can now see the issue and are manually going through page-by-page to fix. 

The reasoning for the issue is due to the way the site was originally developed. Assumably it has been added to over time and this is one of those 'gremlins' that will inevitably occur. The most common reason for characters such as these appearing is when text is copied from another source (such as another web page, email, Google Doc etc.) and WordPress doesn't know how to interpret the random characters, so essentially replaces them with the symbol you are seeing. 

There is very little that can be done to prevent this from occurring again, other than the good practice of coping and pasting new content into notepad or some sort of plain text editor prior to copying and pasting the content into the website. Newer, more robust WordPress setups can handle and interpret these extra characters, but as this site is ageing there needs to be some extra caution taken. 

I hope this makes sense, happy to jump on a call later today if not. Rica will let you know once the she has checked the pages.
@joel @manuel please take a look onto this , it seems that symbols are showing up all over the websites. Can you please check what seems to be the problem? thanks!

Hi Rica,

As per my previous email, the symbols are also found on other pages that I've not provided screenshots for. Would the team be able to scan through the website to find the symbols?

We've also noticed that while the symbol is gone on the Orthodontic's page, the question mark is still there on the text: https://cbo.d.pr/KeLYmh.

I would also like to request an explanation/solution to the recurring issue. That way, we can manage the client's expectations and provide a recommendation on how we can prevent the error from happening again.

Looking forward to your response.

Kind Regards,



William Yap
Senior Digital Marketing Manager
